column37: Bred to sprint and he stepped up on his three novice/maiden runs when collared late on in a 6f nursery here 19 days ago (heavy ground; still looked green); went through that race like the best horse and dropping back to 5f won't hurt; more to come.

column37: Heavy-ground winner over 7f on final 2yo start; conditions have mostly been difficult for her this year but her staying-on third of ten at Bath (1m, good to soft) 15 days ago was more promising; in the thick of it if adding cheekpieces has a good effect.

column36: Mixed since winning over 1m in July; fair heavy-ground 6th latest; more needed to win
column37: Off the mark when winning at Bath (1m, firm) in July but hasn't run to the same level since; heavy ground didn't seem totally unsuitable when a keeping-on sixth of 11 at Bath (1m) recently but more is needed for win purposes.

column37: Broke duck over C&D (good to soft) in June; had a trip query over 1m4f here latest but he failed through getting hampered rather than lack of stamina; looks in good heart and has possibilities.

column37: Won two in a row over 1m (firm and good to firm) last summer; not in the same form in just three runs this year and although he ran well on soft as a 2yo he's an unknown quantity these days back from a break.

column37: Most races over shorter, off the mark over 7f at Chepstow (soft; first-time cheekpieces) this month but stamina didn't seem to be a problem back over 1m when a close sixth of 11 at Bath since; thereabouts.

column37: Sole win on AW (7f); no evidence that he wants soft ground and he was well held behind Fifty Sent in a C&D classified on that ground last month.

column37: Soundly beaten when upped to 1m2f for handicap debut on AW but she fared much better, despite being unable to sustain her effort over 1m, when fifth of ten at Bath (good to soft) recently; may yet find more.

column37: Outclassed his rivals in a C&D handicap in July (good ground) and followed up at Chepstow nine days later; better form in defeat since and although this is more competitive than the numbers might suggest, he's a leading contender.

column19: Roach Power should go well once again but a 5lb rise for GUITEAU's easy 6f win here last time could prove lenient.

column37: Two wins this year, the second coming over C&D in July off a 4lb lower mark (good ground); solid placed efforts on his last two starts; needs more to defy this mark.

column19: Roach Power should go well once again but a 5lb rise for GUITEAU's easy 6f win here last time could prove lenient.

column36: Back to last winning mark but he's yet to shine in three runs for his new stable
column37: Strong traveller with eight wins on his record, the latest off this mark in March (5f, AW); well beaten in three starts for his new stable though and enough to prove at present.

column19: Roach Power should go well once again but a 5lb rise for GUITEAU's easy 6f win here last time could prove lenient.

column36: Impressive in these accessories over 6f here 19 days ago; 5lb rise could prove lenient
column37: Not straightforward but he has more ability than his mark and his last two wins have been emphatic ones, latterly a near-5l success over 6f here 19 days ago (heavy; first time accessories); that form has been boosted by the reopposing Diamondsinthesand and a 5lb rise still leaves him lower than when running away with an Epsom handicap last summer (7f, good to soft); 5f asks a different question of him but his stamina will be an asset and they are likely to go hard.

column19: Roach Power should go well once again but a 5lb rise for GUITEAU's easy 6f win here last time could prove lenient.

column36: C&D win last month; conditions will suit but more minor money perhaps her best hope
column37: Took advantage of a good opportunity over C&D last month but came up short off higher marks twice since; conditions will be fine but others are more appealing.

column19: Roach Power should go well once again but a 5lb rise for GUITEAU's easy 6f win here last time could prove lenient.

column37: He has won three of his last five starts, all over further (two over 6f at this track); 6lb rise for latest Bath win means he is now worse off with Guiteau than when fifth behind him 19 days ago; first 5f run in over two years.
